org.youscope.plugin.nemesys

Class NemesysJobConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.youscope.common.job.JobConfiguration
      • org.youscope.plugin.nemesys.NemesysJobConfiguration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Configuration, TableConsumerConfiguration, TableProducerConfiguration

    public class NemesysJobConfiguration
extends JobConfiguration
implements TableConsumerConfiguration, TableProducerConfiguration
    This job takes controls the syringes of a Nemesys device.
    Author:
    Moritz Lang
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String SCRIPT_ENGINE_TIMETABLE
      Script engine name representing that the script to control the syringes is a simple time-table, for which an own interpreter is written.
      static java.lang.String TYPE_IDENTIFIER
      The identifier for this measurement type.

      • getTypeIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getTypeIdentifier()
        Description copied from interface: Configuration
        Returns a unique identifier for this configuration type. The identifier is used to determine factories and addons to construct and configure jobs, measurements, etc., given a corresponding configuration. Make sure that the ID returned is unique. The returned identifier should conform to "XXX.YYY", where XXX stands for an identifier of the organizational unit or the person who created the configuration (e.g. ETH, Smith, Cindarella), and YYY stands for an identifier of the specific kind of configuration (e.g. AutofocusJob, PlatePosition, MicroplateMeasurement). Optionally, additional hierarchy levels can be defined by additional separators ., e.g. "YouScope.AutofocusJob.Version1.1" The identifier should not contain spaces, non-ASCII characters, or colons (except for hierarchy level separation). Identifiers should start with a capital character, i.e. A-Z. Make sure to not use the same identifier for different configurations, since this might result in unexpected behavior or errors. Make
        Specified by:
        getTypeIdentifier in interface Configuration
        Returns:
        Unique identifier of the configuration type.

      • setScript

        public void setScript(java.lang.String script)
        Sets the script which controls the syringes, i.e. how the flow rates vary over time.
        Parameters:
        script - The script to set.

      • getScript

        public java.lang.String getScript()
        Returns the script which controls the syringes, i.e. how the flow rates vary over time.
        Returns:
        Nemesys syringe control script.

      • setNemesysDevice

        public void setNemesysDevice(java.lang.String nemesysDevice)
        Sets the ID of the Nemesys device which should be controlled. An error will be thrown later in the job initialization if the device does not exist or is not a Nemesys device.
        Parameters:
        nemesysDevice - The ID of the nemesys device.

      • getNemesysDevice

        public java.lang.String getNemesysDevice()
        Returns the ID of the Nemesys device which should be controlled, or null if yet not set.
        Returns:
        The ID of the nemesys device, or null.

      • getConsumedTableDefinition

        public TableDefinition getConsumedTableDefinition()
        Description copied from interface: TableConsumerConfiguration
        Returns a information about the layout of the tables which are consumed by the TableConsumer, e.g. the number and types of columns.
        Specified by:
        getConsumedTableDefinition in interface TableConsumerConfiguration
        Returns:
        Information about of the layout of the consumed tables.

      • getProducedTableDefinition

        public TableDefinition getProducedTableDefinition()
        Description copied from interface: TableProducerConfiguration
        Returns the definition of the table layout of the tables produced by this producer, e.g. the number and types of its columns. This function should return the same TableDefinition as is returned by a measurement component created by this configuration, see TableProducer.getProducedTableDefinition().
        Specified by:
        getProducedTableDefinition in interface TableProducerConfiguration
        Returns:
        Information about of the produced tables.

      • setTableSaveName

        public void setTableSaveName(java.lang.String tableSaveName)
        Sets the name (without extension) of the file to which the flow rate and volume information of the syringe pumps should be stored during evaluation. Set to null to not store anything to a file.
        Parameters:
        tableSaveName - Name of the file (without extension) where the Nemesys state should be saved, or null.

      • getTableSaveName

        public java.lang.String getTableSaveName()
        Returns the name (without extension) of the file to which the flow rate and volume information of the syringe pumps should be stored during evaluation. Returns null if not storing anything to a file.
        Returns:
        Name of the file (without extension) where the Nemesys state should be saved, or null.

      • checkConfiguration

        public void checkConfiguration()
                        throws ConfigurationException
        Description copied from interface: Configuration
        Checks the current state of the configuration. If the configuration state is valid, the method returns normally. If not, a ConfigurationException is thrown describing the error, and what has to be changed in the configuration, by the user, such that it becomes valid. This error can then e.g. be displayed to the user (see ConfigurationAddonTools.displayConfigurationInvalid(ConfigurationException, YouScopeClient).
        Specified by:
        checkConfiguration in interface Configuration
        Overrides:
        checkConfiguration in class JobConfiguration
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException
